info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 14 at 2:38AM CST until January 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas and southeast Oklahoma. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to noon CST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from noon Sunday to 6 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
